intro: Metrosideros saligna, commonly known as the coastal kohuhu, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a small, deciduous tree or shrub that typically grows along coastal areas, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting native birds and insects. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive reddish-brown color when young. Metrosideros saligna plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for local wildlife.
